reviewText: William Dieterle's SEPTEMBER AFFAIR is a classic romance/melodrama that stars Joseph Cotten as an industrialist and Joan Fontaine as a concert pianist. (Cameo: Producer Hal Wallis as a tourist in a Capri shop.)SYNOPSIS-Two career-driven people who fall in love when they meet in Rome have the opportunity to stay together after the plane they should have been on crashes and they're reported as dead. They both abandon their previous lives and rent a villa in Florence. The relationship blossoms until the man's estranged wife arrives in Italy to investigate a large withdrawal her husband made from their bank account just prior to the air accident.As of 2/09, SEPTEMBER AFFAIR was not available on DVD.Also recommended:Joan Fontaine portrays Rowena and co-stars with Robert Taylor and Liz Taylor in the 1952 adaptation of Sir Walter Scott's IVANHOE.  (VHS edition)  (DVD edition)Joseph Cotten and Alida Valli, who appeared in 1949 with Orson Welles in THE THIRD MAN  (VHS edition)  (DVD edition), reunited a year later for the romantic noir,WALK SOFTLY, STRANGER.  (VHS only)Parenthetical number preceding title is a 1 to 10 viewer poll rating found at a film resource website.(6.9) September Affair (1950) - Joan Fontaine/Joseph Cotten/Franoise Rosay/Jessica Tandy/Robert Arthur/Jimmy Lydon (uncredited: Hal B. Wallis)
summary: Love flourishes, then flounders in Florence
Title: N/A

reviewText: I expected more--the story is not very compelling.  The relationship between Cotten and Fontaine seemed in some ways juvenile and self-indulgent, not the tragic grand passion it was supposed to be.  I thought Jessica Tandy's character was the most interesting, and I did like the scene towards the end where you see each character listening to Fontaine's concert from their separate vantage points.This is not a great film, but it has some interest.
Title: N/A

reviewText: One of the better movies that starred Joan Fontaine. If the movie was produced in technicolor, it would have been spectacular because of its location in Italy. Jessica Tandy, a remarkably talented actress, made an impact in her supporting role. This movie is thoroughly enjoyable and worthwhile watching a couple of times a year.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have watched this movie a few days ago. Throughout I was wondering how I never purchased this movie earlier and made it part of my collection. The scenary was great; the exotic Capri locations made every moment sheer delight. Joan Fontaine is perfect for the role she portrayed. Francoise Rosay, who plays Fontaine's friend and mentor, happens to be a very famous and talented French actress. The antique furniture shown in her villa was absolutely tasteful and beautiful. I highly recommend this movie to all of those who collect classics.
Title: N/A

reviewText: September Affair is one of the "essential" movies for any library.  Shame it is not on DVD.  The story is timeless - two people who are presumed dead live their lives as if beginning again.  Fate, however, intervenes, and eveything must go according to real life.  I would recommend this film to any film lover, and it should be in everyone's library.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Yes, the 1950s gave us a rehash of the morality play of the prior decade only with lots of Italian travelogue thrown in and much less class.  Only the music is the same.  It's amazing how much work the movies give Rachmaninoff.  The problem is, in this movie, you almost feel you're being lectured by Hollywood about the ethics of the day and it's entirely unconvincing unlike Brief Encounter.

reviewText: The acting was great.  The script was well written.  The cinematography was suburb.  You will like this movie a lot.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Joseph Cotton and Joan Fontaine have a natural chemistry in "September Affair". These two could act their way out of a box! Breathtaking onsite filming of scenic Italy and easy conversational dialogue make this film flow effortlessly to its end. Never artificial or maudlin. Superior acting by all. Effective use of foreshadowing and mirror characters. Only minor criticism is the rather cheap ending scene (I guess they used up their expense budget in Roma!). Enjoyable with a timeless theme of responsibility versus love. This film tops "An Affair to Remember" in every regard (except the use of Technicolor, of course). If you have an adult palate for romance, hunt down "September Affair"! A rare film that never shows it age.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Joseph Cotten and Joan Fontaine are wonderful as the two main story characters. They are convincing in their portrayals of two people who fall in love and go to desperate means to be together. Women who love a good sentimental love story will bring out the tissue box in this great drama. I love this movie and hope that soon it will come out on DVD so that more viewers can enjoy this it as I do. At least a 4 hankie movies ladies.

reviewText: I don't understand how SEPTEMBER AFFAIR has not yet been made available in DVD format.  After watching it on Youtube (very decent image and sound, by the way), I became quite interested in buying it for my personal DVD collection.  I imagine quite a few people feel the same way.  This is a wonderful film, with a good script, witty dialogue, beautiful location shooting in post-war Italy (Rome, Florence, Naples and Capri), and the quartet of actors (Cotten, Fontaine, Tandy and Rosay) is absolutely terrific.  The melodrama is well-handled, tasteful and never mawkish.  I hope to own this film one day.
summary: A good melodrama, tasteful and well-acted
Title: N/A

reviewText: Can one find better chemistry than that between Joan Fontaine and Joseph Cotten?  What a wonderful movie!  Superb acting by the entire cast.  The story is very intriguing as two travelers in Italy, meet and are strongly attracted to each other, but realize this affair cannot be allowed to be more than a nice afternoon together, as he has a wife waiting for his return, and their airplane will be leaving soon.  However, fate intervenes as they miss their flight and decide to spend the night in romantic Napels and take a plane the next day.  Reading in the newspaper the following  morning, they find that the plane on which they were originally supposed to fly, has crashed and all on-board were killed.  Looking over the list of dead, they are stunned to find their names listed and realize that after missing their plane, the crew had not up-dated the passenger manifest to show their absence.  It's as if life has granted the two lovers a chance to re-do their lives, or has it?  Lovers of Rochmaninoff's concertos will love this movie, and Joan Fontaine does a credible turn as a concert pianist longing to return to her work.  If you're a romantic, this is a must-see for you!
summary: Looking for an enjoyable movie, well-written and with superb acting?  Then don't miss this one!

reviewText: I enjoyed this movie very much. I liked all the places the characters visited in Italy and the history someone always explained. Two of my favorite actor and actress--Joseph Cotton and Joan Fontaine are fabulous--as always. The plot was very well planned and carried through believably--never quite sure how it would end until it was actually finished. That was my only fault--the abruptness of the end--just not enough explaination of what the two were thinking and planning for the future. Over-all excellent movie and would recommend it to Adult date night couples, married couples, or even  just by yourself.
